programme.title: Sliding Madness | Skeleton with James and Teddy
programme.desc: James McGuire and Teddy Fitzsimons are two Skeleton riders from Team USA. We follow their participation during the Winter Youth Olympic Games Lausanne 2020. The competition took place in the only natural track in the world, the historical Olympia Bob Run. From the first training session to the competition, from a Raclette dinner to a Curling activity between the different Olympics Teams, we follow the Olympic journey of James and Teddy during their stay in St. Moritz.

programme.title: Picabo | Five Rings Films
programme.desc: A charismatic tour-de-force, American Picabo Street took the alpine skiing world by storm in the 1990’s by winning Olympic silver and gold. But beneath the bravado and success lay a turbulent and complicated home life. Co-directed by Frank Marshall and Lindsey Vonn.

programme.title: A Brilliant Curling Story | Five Rings Films
programme.desc: Led by skip Rhona Martin, five unassuming women from Scotland unite for a shot at Olympic curling glory – and end up capturing the hearts of a nation in the process.

programme.title: Competition Season Officially Begins | On Edge
programme.desc: It’s 4 months until Beijing 2022. Four of the teams arrive to Helsinki, Finland, for their first big competition of the season. Olivia and Adrian come face to face with the other Spanish team fighting for the same Olympic spot. Guillaume talks about his coming out story. Madison and Evan are eager to try their brand-new program. Filmed in the last six months leading up to Beijing 2022, On Edge is the Olympic Channel’s first weekly figure skating reality docuseries featuring athletes Madison Chock and Evan Bates (USA), Gabriella Papadakis and Guillaume Cizeron (FRA), Madison Hubbell and Zach Donohue (USA), Olivia Smart and Adrian Diaz (ESP), Laurence Fournier-Beaudry and Nikolaj Sorensen (CAN), Lilah Fear and Lewis Gibson (GBR), and coaches Marie-France Dubreuil and Patrice Lauzon, Romain Haguenauer and three time Olympic Gold medallist Scott Moir.

programme.title: A Great Start to the Season | On Edge
programme.desc:
It’s the teams’ first chance of the season to try their brand-new ice dancing programs in competition and in front of a live audience. Olivia and Adrian have a decisive performance for their Olympic qualification. Gabriella and Guillaume compete for the first time in 20 months. Madison and Evan get to see how the crowd react to try their new program. Lilah and Lewis are in for a great start.
Filmed in the last six months leading up to Beijing 2022, On Edge is the Olympic Channel’s first weekly figure skating reality docuseries featuring athletes Madison Chock and Evan Bates (USA), Gabriella Papadakis and Guillaume Cizeron (FRA), Madison Hubbell and Zach Donohue (USA), Olivia Smart and Adrian Diaz (ESP), Laurence Fournier-Beaudry and Nikolaj Sorensen (CAN), Lilah Fear and Lewis Gibson (GBR), and coaches Marie-France Dubreuil and Patrice Lauzon, Romain Haguenauer and three time Olympic Gold medallist Scott Moir.

programme.title: From Helsinki to Vegas | On Edge
programme.desc:
Back from Finland, the teams are prepping for the beginning of the ice dancing Grand Prix season. Four of the teams compete in Skate America 2021 in Vegas, where Madi and Zach defend their title, and Madi and Evan try to go for the win. Lilah and Guillaume talk about the homophobic remarks that came out of Finland.
Filmed in the last six months leading up to Beijing 2022, On Edge is the Olympic Channel’s first weekly figure skating reality docuseries featuring athletes Madison Chock and Evan Bates (USA), Gabriella Papadakis and Guillaume Cizeron (FRA), Madison Hubbell and Zach Donohue (USA), Olivia Smart and Adrian Diaz (ESP), Laurence Fournier-Beaudry and Nikolaj Sorensen (CAN), Lilah Fear and Lewis Gibson (GBR), and coaches Marie-France Dubreuil and Patrice Lauzon, Romain Haguenauer and three time Olympic Gold medallist Scott Moir.

programme.title: The Top Teams Face Off in Torino | On Edge
programme.desc:
Coach Marie-France Dubreuil’s two top teams arrive in Torino for the Italian Grand Prix 2021: Madison and Zach, and Grabriella and Guillaume. Both coming from fresh wins at Skate America and Finlandia Trophy, this is the first time they compete against each other in this season 2021-2022 season.
Filmed in the last six months leading up to Beijing 2022, On Edge is the Olympic Channel’s first weekly figure skating reality docuseries featuring athletes Madison Chock and Evan Bates (USA), Gabriella Papadakis and Guillaume Cizeron (FRA), Madison Hubbell and Zach Donohue (USA), Olivia Smart and Adrian Diaz (ESP), Laurence Fournier-Beaudry and Nikolaj Sorensen (CAN), Lilah Fear and Lewis Gibson (GBR), and coaches Marie-France Dubreuil and Patrice Lauzon, Romain Haguenauer and three time Olympic Gold medallist Scott Moir.

programme.title: Opening Ceremony | Winter Youth Olympic Games Gangwon 2024
programme.desc: Watch the Opening Ceremony of the fourth edition of the Winter Youth Olympic Games in Gangwon, Republic of Korea.

programme.title: Sliding Madness | A journey on Luge, Speed Skating, Skeleton & Monobob tracks
programme.desc: St. Moritz, Switzerland, January 2020, the Winter Youth Olympic Games. Skeleton, Luge, Speed Skating and Monobob are the four disciplines that are hosted in the Alpine village. Teenage athletes from all around the globe participate for the first time in an Olympic Games, not only the competition is important to them, the friendship between Teams, the camaraderie and the Olympic Spirit embrace these young athletes during these Games leaving them all with an unforgettable experience.

programme.title: Nagano 1998: How skating elegance and jumping excellence inspired a nation
programme.desc: Twenty years on from Nagano, we take a look at the impact a glorious Winter Games has had, from ski-jumping to curling and much more.

programme.title: Sliding Madness | Monobob with Camila and Nathan
programme.desc: Follow Camila Copain and Nathan Besnard from Team France in this Monobob chapter and final episode from the Winter Youth Olympic Games 2020. From training, track walks, gym workouts, and all the preparation that these athletes need to go through. There is a bittersweet ending as Camila and Nathan finally ranked 5th and 4th in the competition despite all the hard work and effort, a medal place was out of reach during these Games.

programme.title: What makes Norway the most decorated country in the Winter Olympics?
programme.desc: From the mountains to the arctic waters, explore the Norwegian cuisine fuelling its elite ski jumping and cross-country teams.

programme.title: Highest Air
programme.desc: The world’s top snowboarders attempt to break the world’s record for how high you can jump out of the halfpipe. Will they succeed? Filmed in Saas Fee, Switzerland, in October 2020, the film features snowboarders Scotty James, Ayumu Hirano, Chase Josey, Maddie Mastro, Taylor Gold, Pat Burgener, Leilani Ettel and skier Dylan Marineau.

programme.title: China’s Yang Yang | Legends Live On
programme.desc: The first-ever gold medallist for China at the Olympic Winter Games, Yang Yang, is now helping others fulfil their dreams by mentoring young athletes.

programme.title: Wrapping Up the Grand Prix Season | On Edge
programme.desc:
With the sixth and final Grand Prix completed, coach Marie-France Dubreuil reflects on what each of the teams have achieved so far. Zach is curious about Madison and Adrian’s wedding plans. Gabriella makes an intriguing prediction about the Beijing 2022 Winter Olympics podium.
Filmed in the last six months leading up to Beijing 2022, On Edge is the Olympic Channel’s first weekly figure skating reality docuseries featuring athletes Madison Chock and Evan Bates (USA), Gabriella Papadakis and Guillaume Cizeron (FRA), Madison Hubbell and Zach Donohue (USA), Olivia Smart and Adrian Diaz (ESP), Laurence Fournier-Beaudry and Nikolaj Sorensen (CAN), Lilah Fear and Lewis Gibson (GBR), and coaches Marie-France Dubreuil and Patrice Lauzon, Romain Haguenauer and three time Olympic Gold medallist Scott Moir.

programme.title: Training Tensions and hobbies | On Edge
programme.desc:
The teams are getting ready for the second half of the Olympic season. Olivia and Adrian make ballroom dancing fine touches to their program ahead of the decisive Spanish nationals. Madison shows off her manicure skills while chatting with Lilah about the meaning of competing at the Olympics. COVID derails the Grand Prix Final and Nikolaj demonstrates his knife-making hobby to Zach who discusses his impending retirement.
Filmed in the last six months leading up to Beijing 2022, On Edge is the Olympic Channel’s first weekly figure skating reality docuseries featuring athletes Madison Chock and Evan Bates (USA), Gabriella Papadakis and Guillaume Cizeron (FRA), Madison Hubbell and Zach Donohue (USA), Olivia Smart and Adrian Diaz (ESP), Laurence Fournier-Beaudry and Nikolaj Sorensen (CAN), Lilah Fear and Lewis Gibson (GBR), and coaches Marie-France Dubreuil and Patrice Lauzon, Romain Haguenauer and three time Olympic Gold medallist Scott Moir.

programme.title: A Spanish Duel for the Holiday Season | On Edge
programme.desc:
It's down to the wire as Olivia and Adrian travel to Jaca, Spain, to compete against their rivals for the Spanish Olympic spot. Losing is not an option. Back in Montreal, Madison and Evan who decided to be safe and spend the holidays in Canada, share their hopes and expectations from the coming Olympic Games.
Filmed in the last six months leading up to Beijing 2022, On Edge is the Olympic Channel’s first weekly figure skating reality docuseries featuring athletes Madison Chock and Evan Bates (USA), Gabriella Papadakis and Guillaume Cizeron (FRA), Madison Hubbell and Zach Donohue (USA), Olivia Smart and Adrian Diaz (ESP), Laurence Fournier-Beaudry and Nikolaj Sorensen (CAN), Lilah Fear and Lewis Gibson (GBR), and coaches Marie-France Dubreuil and Patrice Lauzon, Romain Haguenauer and three time Olympic Gold medallist Scott Moir.

programme.title: Full House for Beijing 2022 | On Edge
programme.desc:
In this 12th and final episode of On Edge, the teams put the final touches on their programs ahead of the Beijing 2022 Olympics. Gabby and Guillaume, back from a win at the French National Championships, are focused on beating their Russian rivals at the Games. Madison and Zach, skating for their last time at the US National Championships, go head to head against Madison and Evan. Scott Moir explains what it takes to make an Olympic podium.
Filmed in the last six months leading up to Beijing 2022, On Edge is the Olympic Channel’s first weekly figure skating reality docuseries featuring athletes Madison Chock and Evan Bates (USA), Gabriella Papadakis and Guillaume Cizeron (FRA), Madison Hubbell and Zach Donohue (USA), Olivia Smart and Adrian Diaz (ESP), Laurence Fournier-Beaudry and Nikolaj Sorensen (CAN), Lilah Fear and Lewis Gibson (GBR), and coaches Marie-France Dubreuil and Patrice Lauzon, Romain Haguenauer and three time Olympic Gold medallist Scott Moir.

programme.title: The Journey Ends with Triumph at Beijing 2022 | On Edge
programme.desc:
This special extra episode of On Edge, chronicles the Beijing 2022 experience of our six teams as their months of training and preparation culminates in success for all of them in the Olympic Ice Dance competition.
Filmed in the last six months leading up to Beijing 2022, On Edge is the Olympic Channel’s first weekly figure skating reality docuseries featuring athletes Madison Chock and Evan Bates (USA), Gabriella Papadakis and Guillaume Cizeron (FRA), Madison Hubbell and Zach Donohue (USA), Olivia Smart and Adrian Diaz (ESP), Laurence Fournier-Beaudry and Nikolaj Sorensen (CAN), Lilah Fear and Lewis Gibson (GBR), and coaches Marie-France Dubreuil and Patrice Lauzon, Romain Haguenauer and three time Olympic Gold medallist Scott Moir.

programme.title: The in-line roller Champion ready to make Olympic History | Winter Tracks
programme.desc: Erin Jackson shook the speed skating world in 2017 by qualifying for PyeongChang 2018, only four months after she first stepped foot on ice. She was the first black woman to compete for the U.S. Olympic long track speed skating team. Supported by family and friends, she is now ready to take gold at next Olympic Winter Games.

programme.title: We Are One
programme.desc: This documentary tells the story of the emotional journey of how the Unified Korean Team came to be and its legacy.

programme.title: Sliding Madness | A journey on Luge, Speed Skating, Skeleton & Monobob tracks
programme.desc: St. Moritz, Switzerland, January 2020, the Winter Youth Olympic Games. Skeleton, Luge, Speed Skating and Monobob are the four disciplines that are hosted in the Alpine village. Teenage athletes from all around the globe participate for the first time in an Olympic Games, not only the competition is important to them, the friendship between Teams, the camaraderie and the Olympic Spirit embrace these young athletes during these Games leaving them all with an unforgettable experience.

programme.title: My Great Winter Olympic Moments with Alexis Pinturault
programme.desc: Alexis Pinturault is one of the best World Cup skiers out there. With 34 victories, Pinturault is the most successful French skier in World Cup history. He represented France at five World Championships and two Winter Olympics. In this edition of My Great Winter Olympic Moments, he talks about his Olympics medals so far, dreams of stepping up to gold in Beijing 2022, and, maybe a finale at Milano Cortina 2026?

programme.title: Aussie SBX leader overcomes all odds for a chance to medal | Winter Tracks
programme.desc: Belle Brockhoff is one of the leaders of Australia’s exciting new crop of Winter Athletes. With only 3 to 4 months on snow per year, she already overcame a serious knee injury to compete in 2018 and is now ranked third overall in the World Cup standings

programme.title: Halfpipe Hype | The Joy of Riding
programme.desc: The world’s best snowboarders reveal their addiction to going high: the unique sensory feeling of ‘getting air’ jumping out of a halfpipe.

programme.title: Halfpipe Hype | The Dangers
programme.desc: Is halfpipe riding the most dangerous Olympic sport? Athletes reveal the dangers and fears they must overcome to succeed.

programme.title: Halfpipe Hype | The Science
programme.desc: Athletes, sports scientists, halfpipe builders and snowboard makers reveal the factors that determine how high a rider can air.

programme.title: Halfpipe Hype | Ayumu Hirano Returns
programme.desc: After chasing his Olympic skateboarding dream, Japan’s two-time Olympic silver medallist Ayumu Hirano is back on his snowboard in search of gold.

programme.title: Turin 2006: When short track success and a luge legend inspired a generation
programme.desc: How a luge legend, team short track speed skating glory and a trailblazing skiing hero stirred Italian sporting passions in 2006

programme.title: Speed Skating’s World-Famous Pep Band
programme.desc: Kleintje Pils – literally ‘little beer’ in Dutch – is THE popular can’t miss staple of Winter Olympic Games and speed skating competitions.

programme.title: The sixth and final winter Olympics for India's luge legend
programme.desc: The inspiring full story of India's Shiva Keshavan, showcasing his training, qualification, and participation in PyeongChang 2018.

programme.title: Anatomy of a Figure Skater: What are Mae Berenice Meite's hidden powers?
programme.desc: The French Olympic finalist demostrates surprising all round body strength and control.

programme.title: Rise of Women Olympians
programme.desc: The Olympic Series Vol.5, Program 1 : The story of Women at the Games, Rise of Women Olympians.

programme.title: Nagano 1998: How skating elegance and jumping excellence inspired a nation
programme.desc: Twenty years on from Nagano, we take a look at the impact a glorious Winter Games has had, from ski-jumping to curling and much more.

programme.title: Sliding Madness | A journey on Luge, Speed Skating, Skeleton & Monobob tracks
programme.desc: St. Moritz, Switzerland, January 2020, the Winter Youth Olympic Games. Skeleton, Luge, Speed Skating and Monobob are the four disciplines that are hosted in the Alpine village. Teenage athletes from all around the globe participate for the first time in an Olympic Games, not only the competition is important to them, the friendship between Teams, the camaraderie and the Olympic Spirit embrace these young athletes during these Games leaving them all with an unforgettable experience.

programme.title: Highest Air
programme.desc: The world’s top snowboarders attempt to break the world’s record for how high you can jump out of the halfpipe. Will they succeed? Filmed in Saas Fee, Switzerland, in October 2020, the film features snowboarders Scotty James, Ayumu Hirano, Chase Josey, Maddie Mastro, Taylor Gold, Pat Burgener, Leilani Ettel and skier Dylan Marineau.

programme.title: Sliding Madness | Luge with Nat and Cat
programme.desc: For the first time, a competition of Women's Doubles Luge is being hosted in an Olympic Games. Teenagers Caitlin Nash and Natalie Corless from the Canadian Team arrive at the Olympia Bob Run to do the track walk with their coach Matt Murray. We follow their participation during the Olympic Games: training, sleds preparation and the day of competition. Following a tricky first round in the Competition Day, the Canadian couple makes some sled adjustment and in the second and final round they secure the silver medal in what was an emotional journey through friendship, camaraderie, and the thrills and spills of this awesome sliding discipline.

programme.title: Sliding Madness | Skeleton with James and Teddy
programme.desc: James McGuire and Teddy Fitzsimons are two Skeleton riders from Team USA. We follow their participation during the Winter Youth Olympic Games Lausanne 2020. The competition took place in the only natural track in the world, the historical Olympia Bob Run. From the first training session to the competition, from a Raclette dinner to a Curling activity between the different Olympics Teams, we follow the Olympic journey of James and Teddy during their stay in St. Moritz.

programme.title: France’s Martin Fourcade | Legends Live On
programme.desc: A look at the amazing Olympic achievements of France’s five-time gold medallist Martin Fourcade, and what he is doing now.

programme.title: The Petra Majdic story (extended version)
programme.desc: Despite four broken ribs and a punctured lung, the Slovenian Snow Queen overcame the pain to win cross-country skiing bronze in Vancouver.

programme.title: German’s Sylke Otto | Legends Live On
programme.desc: A look at the Olympic achievements of Germany’s two-time gold medallist Sylke Otto, and what she is doing now.

programme.title: Salt Lake City 2002: How the ‘fastest ice on earth’ fosters homegrown talent
programme.desc: Derek Parra’s stunning Salt Lake City gold stirred a passion in Jerica Tandiman that sees her chasing glory at PyeongChang 2018.

programme.title: Salt Lake City 2002: American halfpipe sweep motivates ‘golden’ siblings
programme.desc: How total American dominance at home put snowboarding in the spotlight and inspired Arielle and Taylor Gold to chase their own Games glory.

programme.title: Italy’s Manuela Di Centa (extended)
programme.desc: Cross-country skier Manuela Di Centa won seven Olympic medals and the hardware comes in handy inspiring future generations through education

programme.title: United States’ Shaun White (extended)
programme.desc: White is one of the greatest snowboarders ever, but his talents extend way beyond sport as a musician, businessman and charity worker

programme.title: Transplant survivor to represent Puerto Rico at next Olympics | Winter Tracks
programme.desc: When William Flaherty was just three years old, he had a bone marrow transplant to save his life. The donor was his brother, Charles. Charles went on to be the first Winter Olympian to represent Puerto Rico in two decades and competed in PyeongChang 2018. Now aged 17, William is preparing to take over for his brother in representing his country at the next Winter Olympic Games.

programme.title: Hockey superstar raised on a farm searching for Olympic glory | Winter Tracks
programme.desc: Jenni Hiirikoski is regarded as one of the finest Ice Hockey players of her generation. She is the captain of Finland’s national team and a future Hall of Famer. Until she was a teenager, Jenni had to play with boys. Later whilst her teammates went on to the NHL, Jenni had to balance competing with working a day job despite being one of the best players ever. She now goes into her fourth Olympics in Beijing knowing it could be her last chance to achieve Olympic glory.

programme.title: Curling’s Globetrotting ‘Beard Guy’ is a Legend in the Sport
programme.desc: Hans Madsen, a construction worker from Saskatchewan, Canada, turns to his colourful collection of 600 wigs to show his support for curling.

programme.title: Speed Skating’s World-Famous Pep Band
programme.desc: Kleintje Pils – literally ‘little beer’ in Dutch – is THE popular can’t miss staple of Winter Olympic Games and speed skating competitions.

programme.title: The Nagano Tapes | Five Rings Films
programme.desc: The inspiring story of how Czech Republic won gold at the first Olympics to feature professionals from the NHL.

programme.title: Canada’s Jayna Hefford | Legends Live On
programme.desc: A look at the Olympic achievements of Canada’s four-time gold medallist Jayna Hefford, and what she is doing now for women’s professional ice hockey.

programme.title: Meet this Big, Competitive Ice Dance Family | On Edge
programme.desc:
Meet the six teams training together at the Ice Academy of Montreal in Canada for the Olympic Games Beijing 2022. Gabriella and Guillaume reflect on their PyeongChang experience. Madison and Zach have some on-ice tension and speak about their emotional connection and Scott Moir tells us what it takes to be an Olympic champion. Filmed in the last six months leading up to Beijing 2022, On Edge is the Olympic Channel’s first weekly figure skating reality docuseries chronicling the day-to-day lives of six teams from five countries training at the Ice Academy of Montreal.
Featuring athletes Madison Chock and Evan Bates (USA), Gabriella Papadakis and Guillaume Cizeron (FRA), Madison Hubbell and Zach Donohue (USA), Olivia Smart and Adrian Diaz (ESP), Laurence Fournier-Beaudry and Nikolaj Sorensen (CAN), Lilah Fear and Lewis Gibson (GBR), and coaches Marie-France Dubreuil and Patrice Lauzon, Romain Haguenauer and three time Olympic Gold medallist Scott Moir.

programme.title: A Mountain of Problems to Solve | On Edge
programme.desc: It is 5 months until Beijing 2022 and as coach Romain Haguenauer puts it: “There is a mountain of problems to solve” technically, artistically and physically for the athletes to be ready. In this second episode of the weekly series On Edge, get an intimate look at how the coaching system at the Academy operates and what it takes to prep the athletes’ programs. Madison and Evan reveal their new routine theme and work on the costume design. Olivia and Adrian perform their new program in front of the coaches and training mates for the first time. Filmed in the last six months leading up to Beijing 2022, On Edge is the Olympic Channel’s first weekly ice dancing reality docuseries chronicling the day-to-day lives of six teams from five countries training at the Ice Academy of Montreal.

programme.title: Big Last-Minute Changes | On Edge
programme.desc: Madison and Evan take the risk of changing their program’s music in the last minute. Madison and Zach are headed to Boston for their first competition of the season. Olivia and Adrian reflect on the coaches’ disappointment and work on improvements. Laurence and Nikolaj open up about Nikolaj’s injury and road to recovery. Filmed in the last six months leading up to Beijing 2022, On Edge is the Olympic Channel’s first weekly figure skating reality docuseries featuring athletes Madison Chock and Evan Bates (USA), Gabriella Papadakis and Guillaume Cizeron (FRA), Madison Hubbell and Zach Donohue (USA), Olivia Smart and Adrian Diaz (ESP), Laurence Fournier-Beaudry and Nikolaj Sorensen (CAN), Lilah Fear and Lewis Gibson (GBR), and coaches Marie-France Dubreuil and Patrice Lauzon, Romain Haguenauer and three time Olympic Gold medallist Scott Moir.

programme.title: Last Touches Before the Start of the Season | On Edge
programme.desc: The teams are prepping for one of the first major competitions of the season: Finlandia Trophy. Madison and Evan take their music changes to the rink. Lilah and Lewis reflect on how they started ice dancing together revealing that their targets are both Beijing 2022 and Cortina 2026. Madison Hubbell tries on costumes and speaks out about her relationship with Adrian. Filmed in the last six months leading up to Beijing 2022, On Edge is the Olympic Channel’s first weekly figure skating reality docuseries chronicling the day-to-day lives of six teams from five countries training at the Ice Academy of Montreal.

programme.title: Ice Hockey: Team Switzerland Men
programme.desc: Relive PyeongChang 2018 through the eyes of the Men’s Swiss Ice Hockey Team and follow their quest for an Olympic Medal

programme.title: Speed and grace
programme.desc: The Olympic Series Vol.5, Program 2 : The story of Women at the Games, Speed and grace.

programme.title: Halfpipe Hype | Highest Ski Air
programme.desc: Canadian Skier Dylan Marineau attempts to break the world record for the highest ski air in a halfpipe.

programme.title: Halfpipe Hype | The Evolution
programme.desc: Featuring epic snowboard airs, the world’s best snowboarders revisit the greatest moments in the history of getting air.
